description: Variation of Condition 2 (in accordance with approved plans) for amendments to the ground floor layout and basement revisions following planning permission for 01054/495-497/P14 dated 03/03/2021 for the erection of a part four part five storey building comprising eight residential units and a public house / restaurant at ground floor with associated amenity space following demolition of the existing building.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 13 July 2022, being the date of granting of planning permission 01054/495-497/P14.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (20054T-01 Issue A, Air Quality Assessment [dated 5 February 2021], Daylight, Sunlight and Overshadowing Report [dated 19 January 2021], Drainage Assessment Form, CMU/21051 (Underground CCTV Survey), Greenfield Runoff Calculations, Energy and Sustainability Statement Revision A [dated February 2021], Noise Impact Assessment [dated 4 January 2021], Phase One Environmental Assessment Report [dated January 2021], Rainfall Profile, Rainfall Profile (2 year), Rainfall Profile (30 year), Rainfall Profile (100 year), Thames Water Asset Location Search & Transport Technical Note [dated February 2021]. Received on 10 February 2021; DWG_00_001_P2, DWG_00_050_P2, DWG_00_050_P3, DWG_00_203_P3, DWG_00_206_P3, DWG_00_210_P3, DWG_00_211_P3, DWG_00_213_P3, DWG_00_221_P3, DWG_00_410_P1, DWG_00_420_P1, DWG_MS_200_P1, DWG_MS_201_P1, DWG_MS_202_P1, DWG_MS_210_P1, DWG_MS_212_P1, DWG_MS_213_P1, DWG_MS_220_P1, DWG_MS_221_P1 & DWG_MS_221_PP1. Received on 3 November 2021; DWG_00_202_P3, DWG_00_204_P3 & DWG_00_205_P3. Received on 19 November 2021; Drainage SUDs Maintenance Strategy [dated January 2022] & Design and Access Statement. Received on 1 February 2022; DWG_00_201_P1, Rainfall Profile (1 year), Rainfall Profile (30 year) & Rainfall Profile (100 year). Received on 15 April 2022; Cover Letter, DWG_00_200_P4 and DWG_00_220_P4, Received on 29/11/2022; Planning Amendment Explanation. Received on 24/01/2023; DWG_00_001_P2. Received on 15/12/2022. Operator and Viability Statement, Pre Let Operator Terms and Photographs of pre-existing basement. Received on 07/02/2023; DWG_00_201_P5 and DWG_00_212_P5. Received on 13/02/2023) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are used.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place above ground level until the developer has entered into a binding contract with the Council that will secure open space improvements towards Hounslow Heath.

Condition : 4 - A.	No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure a suitable contribution to the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy and Sustainability Statement hereby approved.
B.	Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 5 - Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the residential part of the development has achieved an internal water use at each dwelling of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 6 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been completed in accordance with the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement. All construction materials and insulants must be zero ozone depletion.

Condition : 9 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 10 - Prior to the commercial premises being brought into first use, a Management Plan, including a Noise Management Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be operated in accordance with the approved plan.

Condition : 11 - Details of any external plant to be installed on the building hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of the development. Such details shall include any necessary sound reduction strategy/mitigation measures. No further fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the written prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 12 - A.	The use of the ground floor commercial premises (public house / restaurant) shall not commence until a scheme for protecting the proposed residential accommodation from external noise, taking into consideration the recommendations of the Noise Impact Assessment [dated 4 January 2021], shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such a scheme shall include a scheme for the control of fumes and odours and details of measures to ensure the winter gardens meet the relevant standards of BS4142. Any works that form part of such a scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied.
B.	Prior to any part of the development being occupied, sound insulation test reports, demonstrating compliance with the scheme approved under Part A of this condition, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for the provision of adequate lighting around the development. Details shall include measures to reduce lightspill into any nearby residential units. The lighting shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained as such for the duration of the development.
Condition : 14 - No amplified music or other music shall be played outside the commercial premises hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 15 - The commercial unit shall not be occupied until a delivery and servicing plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall provide details to how deliveries and servicing will be undertaken within the site and the measures proposed to restrict loading and unloading on the public highway. All deliveries and servicing of the site shall thereafter be managed in compliance with the approved Delivery & Servicing Plan.

Condition : 16 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until the cycle parking facilities (for not less than 16 bicycles) for the occupants, one long-stay space for staff and short-stay cycle parking facilities (for not less than nine bicycles) for visitors of the development have been made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.

Condition : 17 - A.	No above ground level works (excluding site investigations and demolition) shall take place until a scheme for the storage and collection of recyclable and non-recyclable waste, including a timetable for implementation, has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be accordingly managed as approved.
B.	Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development the waste and recycling stores shall be made available for use in strict accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such, without obstruction, for the duration of the development.

Condition : 18 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant shall have submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing a final detailed drainage design, including drawings and supporting calculations and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to be reviewed and approved by the Lead Local Flood Authority. The drainage hierarchy shall make use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and the runoff rate shall not exceed 2.0 litres/second. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Condition : 19 - No part of the development hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 21 - The ground floor commercial premises shall be only be used for purposes within Classes A4 (public house now sui generis) or A5 (restaurant now Class E (b)) and for no other purpose (including any other purpose within these Use Classes of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2015, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Condition : 22 - The use of the ground floor commercial premises (public house / restaurant) hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside the following times: 08:00am to 11:00pm Mondays to Sundays. No operations shall take place on Public and Bank Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 23 - Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO).

No dwelling shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.
